data.title: U.S. President Trump Orders Federal Agencies to Cease Using Anthropic Technology
data.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has directed all federal agencies to immediately halt the use of Anthropic's technology. According to BlockBeats, Trump announced on Truth Social that the government neither needs nor wants Anthropic's products and will cease business with the company. Agencies currently utilizing Anthropic's technology, such as the Department of Defense, will have a six-month phase-out period. Trump emphasized that Anthropic must cooperate during this transition, warning that failure to do so could result in significant civil and criminal consequences, with the full power of the presidency being used to enforce compliance.

data.title: Institutional Entity Accumulates HYPE Tokens Through Galaxy Digital
data.description: An unidentified institutional entity has been actively purchasing HYPE tokens through Galaxy Digital's over-the-counter (OTC) desk. According to NS3.AI, this accumulation has been ongoing for 18 days, resulting in a total holding of 540,337 HYPE tokens, valued at approximately $14.86 million. This consistent buying activity suggests a significant institutional interest in HYPE.

data.title: Stablecoin Negotiations Face Uncertainty Amid Industry Defense
data.description:
Cryptocurrency journalist Eleanor Terrett reports that several figures in the crypto industry have publicly defended Patrick Witt and the White House's stance following anonymous claims of pessimism regarding stablecoin yield negotiations. According to ChainCatcher, a banking industry insider directly familiar with the negotiations stated that representatives from ABABankers, ICBA, and the Bank Policy Institute, who attended a White House meeting last week, were confused by the anonymous claims and disagreed with the perspective. They have communicated their concerns to the White House.

The insider also noted that both parties are still in ongoing discussions about the bill's text, and the March 1 deadline is not a definitive cutoff date.

data.title: Anthropic Challenges Legal Precedent in Government Negotiations
data.description: Anthropic has expressed concerns over a recent legal determination, arguing that it lacks a solid legal foundation. According to Jin10, the company believes that this decision could set a dangerous precedent for any U.S. company engaged in negotiations with the government. Anthropic's stance highlights the potential implications for future corporate-government interactions.

data.title: U.S. Health Secretary Appoints New Members to Vaccine Committee
data.description: U.S. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has appointed two new members to a key vaccine committee tasked with shaping the country's immunization policy. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the significance of these appointments in influencing national health strategies. The committee plays a crucial role in advising on vaccine-related matters, impacting public health decisions across the United States. The new members are expected to bring fresh perspectives to the committee's ongoing efforts to enhance immunization practices and policies.

data.title: White House Pushes for Crypto and Banking Sector Compromise
data.description: David Sacks, the White House AI and Crypto Affairs Director, has disclosed efforts to mediate between banks and the cryptocurrency industry. According to NS3.AI, Patrick Witt is leading initiatives to establish market structure legislation. Sacks highlighted that the crypto sector has made significant concessions concerning stablecoin yield regulations, urging the banking industry to respond constructively to these changes.

data.title: U.S. Stock Market and Cryptocurrency Sector Experience Declines
data.description: The U.S. stock market ended the trading session with losses across major indices, including the Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq. According to NS3.AI, the cryptocurrency sector also faced declines, with significant drops in tokens such as UPXI, BNC, ETHZ, BMNR, and ABTC. Meanwhile, Msx.com, a decentralized RWA trading platform, continues to list a variety of tokenized U.S. stocks and ETFs.

data.title: Launch: DeepSeek to Release Multimodal Language Model V4 Next Week
data.description: DeepSeek is set to unveil its latest large language model, V4, next week. According to Jin10, this new model is described as 'multimodal,' featuring capabilities for generating images, videos, and text. The release marks a significant advancement in the field of artificial intelligence, offering enhanced functionalities for diverse applications. The model's ability to process and produce various forms of media is expected to broaden its usability across different sectors. This development highlights the ongoing innovation in AI technology, as companies continue to push the boundaries of what these models can achieve.

data.title: Anthropic Attempts Agreement with U.S. Department of Defense
data.description: Anthropic, a company focused on AI safety, has made a good-faith effort to reach an agreement with the U.S. Department of Defense. According to Jin10, the company aims to collaborate on projects that align with its mission of ensuring AI technologies are developed and used responsibly. This move reflects Anthropic's commitment to working with government entities to address potential risks associated with artificial intelligence. The discussions are part of a broader initiative to integrate AI advancements into national defense strategies while maintaining ethical standards. Anthropic's approach highlights the importance of cooperation between tech companies and government agencies in navigating the complexities of AI deployment.

data.title: White House AI and Crypto Director: The crypto industry has made concessions on stablecoin yields; banks should respond.
data.description: David Sacks, the White House's director for AI and crypto affairs, stated on social media that Patrick Witt is pushing for compromise between the banking and crypto industries and actively working to enact market structure legislation. Sacks noted that the crypto industry has made significant concessions on stablecoin yields and called for a corresponding response from banks.

data.title: JPYC, the issuer of the Japanese yen stablecoin, has completed a Series B funding round of approximately $12 million, led by Asteria.
data.description: JPYC, the issuer of the Japanese yen stablecoin, announced the completion of its Series B funding round, raising approximately 1.78 billion yen (about US$12 million). The round was led by Japanese IT solutions provider Asteria, with participation primarily from Japanese companies and funds, and BitFlyer Holdings also investing. JPYC is scheduled to officially launch in October 2025 under Japan's regulatory framework for money transfers, positioning itself as an onshore yen stablecoin. The company has partnered with Densan Systems, which has a payment network covering approximately 65,000 convenience stores in Japan, to explore applications for domestic payments, cross-border remittances, and travel payments within convenience store settings. Furthermore, JPYC is also involved in Circle's StableFX stablecoin foreign exchange quotation system for cross-border settlements. (Ledger Insights)

data.title: Donald Trump Hosts High-Value Fundraising Dinner at Mar-a-Lago
data.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is hosting a fundraising dinner at his Mar-a-Lago estate, with tickets priced at $1 million per attendee. New York Times posted on X, highlighting the event as part of Trump's efforts to bolster his super PAC. The dinner is expected to attract high-profile donors and supporters, reflecting the ongoing financial strategies employed by Trump's political team. The event underscores the significant financial backing Trump continues to receive from his base, as he navigates the political landscape.

data.title: SoFi, the first crypto-chartered bank in the US, launches Solana online deposit functionality.
data.description: SoFi, the first crypto-licensed bank in the United States, has announced support for Solana network deposits. Users can now deposit Solana network assets directly through its banking app.

data.title: Brother Machi's 25x leveraged long position in ETH was liquidated, and he reopened a long position, currently accumulating losses exceeding $29 million.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, with the market correction, Machi's 25x leveraged ETH long position has been completely liquidated. He then opened a new 25x leveraged ETH long position after the liquidation. Currently, Machi's cumulative losses exceed $29 million.

data.title: Altcoin Season Index Shows Slight Increase in Altcoin Performance
data.description: CoinMarketCap's Altcoin Season Index has risen to 35, indicating a modest improvement in altcoin performance compared to Bitcoin. According to NS3.AI, this index evaluates the percentage of the top 100 cryptocurrencies that have outperformed Bitcoin over the last 90 days, excluding stablecoins and wrapped tokens. A score of 75 or higher denotes an 'altcoin season,' while a lower score suggests Bitcoin's dominance.

data.title: US stocks closed lower across the board for crypto stocks, with BMNR falling more than 7.14%.
data.description: According to data from msx.com, at the close of trading on the US stock market, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 1.05%, the S&P 500 fell 0.43%, and the Nasdaq Composite fell 0.92%. The crypto sector was mixed, with UPXI falling over 12.84%, BNC falling over 9.28%, ETHZ falling over 7.59%, BMNR falling over 7.14%, and ABTC falling over 5.56%. msx.com is a decentralized RWA trading platform that has listed hundreds of RWA tokens, covering US stock and ETF tokens such as AAPL, AMZN, GOOGL, META, MSFT, NFLX, and NVDA.

data.title: Hong Kong's Leela Faces Competition from Michelin-Starred Rivals
data.description: Hong Kong's Leela, a high-end Indian restaurant, offers some exceptional dishes that make it worth a visit. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the challenges Leela faces from its Michelin-starred competitors in the region. Despite its culinary offerings, the restaurant must navigate the competitive landscape dominated by established Michelin-rated establishments. The review suggests that while Leela has standout dishes, it needs to distinguish itself further to compete effectively in Hong Kong's vibrant dining scene.

data.title: BlackRock withdrew 10,749 BTC from Coinbase in the past three days, with a total value of approximately $717 million.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, BlackRock withdrew 4,082 BTC from Coinbase 9 hours ago, worth approximately $269.41 million. Data shows that in the past 3 days, BlackRock has withdrawn a total of 10,749 BTC from Coinbase, worth approximately $717.09 million.
